name: PROF. DR. MOHAMMAD OMAR FARUQ
qualification: MBBS, FCPS (Medicine), MD, American Board Certified in Internal Medicine & Emergency Medicine Chief Consultant, General Intensive Care Unit ( G-ICU) & Emergency
about: Prof Omar Faruq is the pioneer in Critical Care Medicine in Bangladesh who has started the first MD course in Critical Care Medicine in BIRDEM.He received his training in Medicine and allied branches in the US in mid 1970s. He passed American Board of Internal Medicine exams in 1982. He also passed American Board of Emergency Medicine in 1990. He was re-certified in American Board of Emergency Medicine in 2001.He did his FCPS in Medicine in 2006.Before joining United Hospital as Consultant General ICU, since 1996 he had been working at BIRDEM General Hospital, Dhaka.

name: DR. ASHIA ALI
about: Dr. Ashia Ali did her graduation (MBBS) from Rangpur Medical College under University of Rajshahi in 1986. She did her Diploma in Anesthesia from University of Dhaka in 1998 and FCPS (Anesthesia) in 2003. She served in Bangabandhu Sheikh Mujib Medical University in the department of Cardiothoracic Anesthesia for long 11 years from 2003 to 2014. Thereafter she joined Apollo Hospitals Dhaka (now Evercare Hospital) as Consultant Anesthesia & ICU and served there from 2014 till 2016. Before joining United Hospital, she served Asgar Ali Hospital as Consultant of Anesthesia & Pain Medicine from end 2016 till mid-2020.Dr Ashia is an expert in management of knee pain, back pain, shoulder pain, neck pain and post-operative long standing pain in addition to managing diabetes complications as in frozen shoulder, any cases of slip disc, severe myalgia and neuralgia. Managing cancer induced pain using Intrathecal pump to deliver morphine in spinal cord, is one of her special proficiency. She is a skilled practitioner of epidural injection, PRP (platelet rich plasma) therapy, ozone (O3) discectomy, dry needling, radio frequency ablation etc in minimizing different painful conditions.

name: Prof.Brig.Gen.Dr.Md.Quadrat-E-Eahi
about: Obtained MBBS degree from Dhaka Medical College under University of Dhaka in 1985 Completed MRCP in Internal Medicine in 2003 from Royal College of Physicians, Ireland Received training in different disciplines of Epidemiology of Rheumatic Fever and Rheumatic heart disease from Aichi Medical University, Japan in 1991 Worked in different hospital of abroad such as Ipoh General Hospital and Queen Elizabeth Hospital of Malaysia, National University Hospital and Tan Tock Seng Hospital of Singapore from 2000 to 2007 Worked in National University of Singapore (NUS) as Research Coordinator from 2007 to 2010 Joined United Hospital in 2010 and serving as Consultant in Internal Medicine Member of COVID steering committee of United Hospital
